title: How to Make Easter Garibaldi Biscuits

steps.headline: Preheat to oven to 160ºC or 325ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the baking tray (sheet) by lining it with baking (parchment) paper or greasing it.

steps.headline: Fold in the flour.
steps.description: Add the mixed spice, currants and candied peel next.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk to form a stiff dough.
Remove the dough and roll on a floured surface to an even width.
Use biscuit/cookie cutters to make the biscuit shapes.
Place each biscuit shape onto the prepared baking tray.
Place in the oven and bake for 10 minutes.
To add a glaze, remove the biscuits from the oven and brush with a little egg white kept aside from the separated egg.
Place the biscuits back into the oven and bake for another 5-10 minutes.
steps.description: The biscuits are ready when they've turned a pale golden-brown colour.

steps.headline: Place the cooling biscuits on a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: Once cooled, they're ready to serve.

text: Preheat to oven to 160ºC or 325ºF. Prepare the baking tray (sheet) by lining it with baking (parchment) paper or greasing it. Cream the butter and sugar. Mix until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolk. Beat in to combine thoroughly. Fold in the flour. Add the mixed spice, currants and candied peel next. Pour in the milk to form a stiff dough.  Remove the dough and roll on a floured surface to an even width.  Use biscuit/cookie cutters to make the biscuit shapes.  Place each biscuit shape onto the prepared baking tray.  Place in the oven and bake for 10 minutes.  To add a glaze, remove the biscuits from the oven and brush with a little egg white kept aside from the separated egg. Sprinkle with sugar. Place the biscuits back into the oven and bake for another 5-10 minutes. The biscuits are ready when they've turned a pale golden-brown colour. Place the cooling biscuits on a wire cooling rack. Once cooled, they're ready to serve.
